alert.note: Alert for Cleveland (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 7:44PM EDT until September 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cleveland. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 741 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy tropical showers lingering and redeveloping across the region. It is possible that rainfall totals could approach 3 inches in spots, especially from around Shelby to Kings Mountain, where flooding of low lying areas will be possible through late evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Shelby, Kings Mountain, Boiling Springs NC, Belwood, Grover, Lawndale, Patterson Springs, Fallston, Polkville, Lattimore, Mooresboro, Waco, Casar, Earl, Kingstown, Crowders Mountain State Park, Kings Mountain State Park and South Mountains State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
